Class AbstractGMLType

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

The AbstractGMLType is any GML object having identity. It includes objects that are GML features, or other objects, with identity. It is effectively an abstract superclass for all GML objects.

[IsoType("AbstractGMLType", IsAbstract = true)]
[JsonObject("AbstractGMLType")]
public abstract class AbstractGMLType : GmlObject, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDbId, IStandardObjectProperties, IId

Properties

Description

Gets/Sets the text description of the object.

[JsonProperty("description", Order = 2, NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Ignore)]
[Obsolete("Marked 'deprecated' in /gml/gmlBase.xsd")]
public StringOrRefType? Description { get; set; }

Property Value

StringOrRefType

Remarks

Description uses StringOrRefType as its content model, so it may contain a simple text string content, or carry a reference to an external description. The use of Description to reference an external description has been deprecated and replaced by the DescriptionReference property.

DescriptionReference

Gets/Sets the remote text description of the object.

[JsonProperty("descriptionReference", Order = 3, NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Ignore)]
public ReferenceType? DescriptionReference { get; set; }

Property Value

ReferenceType

Remarks

The xlink:href attribute of the gml:descriptionReference property references the external description.

Id

Gets/Sets the unique identifier for the GML object.

[JsonProperty("id", Order = 0)]
[JsonRequired]
[Required(AllowEmptyStrings = false, ErrorMessage = "The Id is required and cannot be empty.")]
public required string Id { get; set; }

Property Value

string

A unique string identifier constrained to be document-wide unique in XML.

Remarks

The Id attribute provides a handle for the XML element representing a GML object. It is of XML type ID, meaning it must be unique within the XML document where it occurs.
The use of this attribute is mandatory for all GML objects, ensuring uniqueness and facilitating reference-based associations.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown when attempting to set the Id property to null.

Identifier

Gets/Sets the label or identifier for the object, commonly a descriptive name.

[JsonProperty("identifier", Order = 4, NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Ignore)]
public CodeWithAuthorityType? Identifier { get; set; }

Property Value

CodeWithAuthorityType

Remarks

An object may have several names, typically assigned by different authorities. gml:name uses the gml:CodeType content model. The authority for a name is indicated by the value of its (optional) codeSpace attribute. The name may or may not be unique, as determined by the rules of the organization responsible for the codeSpace. In common usage there will be one name per authority, so a processing application may select the name from its preferred codeSpace.

MetaDataProperty

Gets/Sets the collection of metadata properties associated with the object.

[JsonProperty("metaDataProperty", Order = 1, NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Ignore)]
public ObservableCollection<MetaDataPropertyType>? MetaDataProperty { get; set; }

Property Value

ObservableCollection<MetaDataPropertyType>

Remarks

The MetaDataProperty is used to link metadata to a GML object. It follows the MetaDataPropertyType content model, which allows for association with metadata described by any XML Schema. This property does not inherently imply ownership of the metadata, but ownership can be asserted using the IOwnership.

Name

Gets/Sets the special identifier that is often assigned to an object by the maintaining authority with the intention that it is used in references to the object. For such cases, the codeSpace shall be provided. That identifier is usually unique either globally or within an application domain. gml:identifier is a pre-defined property for such identifiers.

[JsonProperty("name", Order = 5, NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Ignore)]
public ObservableCollection<CodeType>? Name { get; set; }

Property Value

ObservableCollection<CodeType>
